quotes.quote: A mediocre idea that generates enthusiasm will go further than a great idea that inspires no one.
It's a sign of mediocrity when you demonstrate gratitude with moderation.
I'd made it back to the land of the living. No matter how boring or mediocre a world it might be, this was it.
To those whose talents are above mediocrity, the highest subjects may be announced. To those who are below mediocrity, the highest subjects may not be announced.
Everything I've ever done was out of fear of being mediocre.
You know you've reached a new plateau of group mediocrity when even a Canadian is alarmed by your lack of individuality.
Mediocrity is excellent to the eyes of mediocre people.
I try to keep an open mind but I'm so tired of the mediocrity.
Only mediocrity can be trusted to be always at its best.
People who are unable to motivate themselves must be content with mediocrity, no matter how impressive their other talents.
Mediocrity is now, as formerly, dangerous, commonly fatal, to the poet; but among even the successful writers of prose, those who rise sensibly above it are the very rarest exceptions.
The price of excellence is discipline. The cost of mediocrity is disappointment.
Only the mediocre are always at their best.
Creative people are often found either disagreeable or intimidating by mediocrities.
It takes more energy to maintain mediocrity than it takes to pursue excellence.
Women want mediocre men, and men are working to be as mediocre as possible.
Mediocrity doesn't mean average intelligence, it means an average intelligence that resents and envies its betters.
It is a wretched taste to be gratified with mediocrity when the excellent lies before us.
Great artists are people who find the way to be themselves in their art. Any sort of pretension induces mediocrity in art and life alike.
Excellence is a better teacher than mediocrity. The lessons of the ordinary are everywhere. Truly profound and original insights are to be found only in studying the exemplary.
Some people are born mediocre, some people achieve mediocrity, and some people have mediocrity thrust upon them.
To a hungry person, every bitter food is sweet. When the preferable is not available, the available becomes preferable!
It is cruel to discover one's mediocrity only when it is too late. It does not improve the temper.
There's a lot of mediocrity being celebrated, and a lot of wonderful stuff being ignored or discouraged.
Mediocrity will never do. You are capable of something better.
There is always a heavy demand for fresh mediocrity. In every generation the least cultivated taste has the largest appetite.
Perseverance - a lowly virtue whereby mediocrity achieves an inglorious success.
In the republic of mediocrity, genius is dangerous.
Mediocrity knows nothing higher than itself, but talent instantly recognizes genius.
Nothing is as approved as mediocrity, the majority has established it and it fixes it fangs on whatever gets beyond it either way.
